event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a SAS (Serial Attached SCSI) controller.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error was detected within a SAS (Serial Attached SCSI) controller.

The domain using the SAS controller is reset.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The SAS controller is on the Motherboard.

      The SAS controller and all the built-in IO behind the SAS controller is deconfigured
      (built-in HDD disks and built-in DVD drive), after the domain is reset.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      SAS controller is on the IOU.
          
      The SAS controller and all the built-in IO behind the SAS controller is deconfigured
      (built-in HDD disks, built-in DVD drive, and built-in tape drive), after the domain is reset.



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      SAS controllers are on IOU#0 and IOU#1.
          
         If the fatal error occurs on the SAS controller on IOU#0,
           then HDD#0 and HDD#1 will be deconfigured,
             along with the internal DVD drive and internal tape drive.

         If the fatal error occurs on the SAS controller on IOU#1,
           then HDD#2 and HDD#3 will be deconfigured.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

      The SAS controller is located on an IOUA in a PCIe slot.

      The SAS controller and all the built-in IO behind the SAS controller is deconfigured
      (built-in HDD disks, built-in DVD drive, and built-in tape drive), after the domain is reset.

         If the IOUA is in PCI slot 0, then HDD#0 and HDD#1 are deconfigured.

         If the IOUA is in PCI slot 4, then HDD#2 and HDD#3 are deconfigured.

      The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform power cycles
      or across Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:10:56 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 7c525fb4-c2cb-482b-9525-adea888cd126
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-W3 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-W3, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:10:56 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 7c525fb4-c2cb-482b-9525-adea888cd126
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a SAS (Serial Attached SCSI) controller.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-W3 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The internal SAS devices behind the SAS controller (internal HDDs, internal DVD drives, internal
   tape drives) are deconfigured.
   IMPACT: The domain using the SAS controller is reset.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 7c525fb4-c2cb-482b-9525-adea888cd126

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:10:56.5173 7c525fb4-c2cb-482b-9525-adea888cd126 SCF-8001-W3
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pci.sas.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_br=0/sas=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_br=0/sas=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain using the SAS controller is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The internal SAS devices behind the SAS controller (internal HDDs, internal DVD drives, internal tape drives) are deconfigured.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error was detected within a SAS controller.
